The practical coincidence of Gaius and Ulpian with Paulus in describing capitis deminutio minima as a mere change, and not necessarily a change for the worse, involving a degradation, and the fact that they differ from him only in being less clear and emphatic in their definition, is noteworthy, because writers who take a different view upon this subject from that here adopted contend that Paulus is the only jurist by whose writings the latter is supported.
